result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Stipulation and Order
Defendant Record Update

Filed by the State:  Pre-trial set for 05/23/22 @ 10:00 in Br 2 
   Defendant looking to do pre-trial supervision program.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

03:25 PM Defendant Donald E Marin Rivera in court with Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:26 p.m. Police Officer for the City of Stevens Point Z Gartmann is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Cassidy.
3:28 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant; record reflects the identification for purposes of the preliminary hearing only.
3:32 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Bergner.
3:34 p.m.  ADA Cassidy has no re-direct.
ADA Cassidy would ask that the court take judicial notice of the prior charges; judicial notice for the preliminary hearing only.
ADA Cassidy has no additional witnesses.
Atty Bergner has no witnesses.
Atty Bergner gives a final argument.
3:35 p.m.  ADA Cassidy gives her final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:20 PM Defendant Donald E Marin Rivera in court with Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc on behalf of Atty Maxwell Bergner. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
Initial Appearance set for January 18, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

1:29 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 4th Offense with Minor Child in Vehicle, Vehicle Operator - Flee/Elude Officers and Resisting or Obstructing an Officer.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Atty Soule provides the address.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the $5,000 cash bond and would request a lower cash bond and states her reasons on the record.
Court indicates that some cash is necessary and would set a $2,500 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.  

Initial Appearance scheduled for:   January 18, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m.  in Branch 1
